channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-12615] HashQParserPlugin will throw an NPE for string hash key and documents have empty value
item.description:
If I index documents where the partitionKeys keys field is missing from a few docs then the stream expression throws an NPE

docs:

[
{"id" : "1", "search_term_s" : "query1"},
{"id" : "2", "search_term_s" : "query1"},
{"id" : "3"},
{"id" : "4"}
]

 

query

search(test_empty, q="*:*", fl="search_term_s,id" , sort="search_term_s desc", qt="/export", partitionKeys="search_term_s")

 

logs

The problem lies with HashQParserPlugin where we try to partition the data and if a document doesn't have a value for the partition field it throws an NPE
item.summary: HashQParserPlugin will throw an NPE for string hash key and documents have empty value

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch demonstrating the problem and a solution for it.

Still a couple of nocommits which need to be addressed.

The problem would only manifest if the partitionKeys is a string field . Numeric values would doesn't have this issue.

Created SOLR-12624 for this nocommit in the patch

int workers = localParams.getInt("workers", 0);
int worker = localParams.getInt("worker", 0);
//nocommit : if workers and worker both are 0 it will give an java.lang.ArithmeticException: / by zero
//nocommit : if workers and worker both are 0 it will give an java.lang.ArithmeticException: / by zero

jbernste does the patch looks good to you otherwise ?
Updated patch. All tests pass. I plan on committing this later today
